host.host_about:
My name is James from Montreal. I am a Sales and Marketing Professional. 
I have a few hobbies: Organic farming, Photography, Extreme skiing.
I have a few properties I am thinking of listing here and want to try out a few stays in various cities that I regularly visit to have a better understanding of how  Air B and B works. 
James Leahy

reviews.comments:
James' place was great for us, cheap and just enough. It's extremely close to everything and with parking! The view is fantastic. We didn't stay in the Airbnb much but the building is quiet and safe which is what we were looking for. The shower water temp jumps around a bit but pressure is good. The bedroom gets warm in the mornings, James let us know this  
when we arrived, and there was air conditioning and heating which was perfect. The parking is safe and secure as is the front door. For guests looking for a lockbox, we had to meet the host for the key. From there getting in and out of the building is easy. Thanks!

Quiet place with a clear view over Montreal and a private balcony. The decoration is mainly from the 80s but definitely has its charm.
James is a dedicated and reactive host, you can count on him !

Exactly as described. Great location for walking up to Mt. Royal or into the center of down town. ~2 blocks away from guy-concordia metro station. 

One other note: the walls are apparently pretty thin.
James met me with keys, and did everything possible to make me comfortable.  He even offered me champagne!

James was a great host and super responsive. The place is exactly as described, and we took full advantage of the great balcony by having breakfast there every morning. It was the perfect size for the two of us. The place is also very convenient if you’re planning on hiking up to Mont Royal and close enough to the shopping district on Sherbrooke if you’re looking for places to shop or eat. James also has great suggestions if you’re looking for anything in the area. Thanks James! Hope you’ll have us again when we decide to come back to Montreal!

Un bel appartement à Montréal avec une vue du balcon très agréable 
Un accueil au top par James 
Nous recommandons

Great location, short walk to the metro, which is convenient way to get around town. James left very clear instructions and was very easy to work with. If we come back to Montreal, we would stay here again!
James was a gracious host and super awesome communicator. I had a great time and James made the stay even better.
Great parking! Our modest SUV fit under the low pipes overhead. Artistically appointed, and how did you fit that mirror in the door!? Softest bed in Montreal. We’ll be back!
Great location and stylish touches!
James' place was great! It was in a very good location, very comfortable, and James was very responsive. Would definitely stay again!
Fantastic location in a beautiful city. Parking, easy access to the Metro & Art museum, responsive host, and many conveniences made this a great stay. Thank you James!

James is a great host and his space reflects that!   Great spot with a nice view off the balcony.  
Only warning is that his neighbor is crazy and possibly something mentally wrong with.  She started banging on our wall excessively when we made some noise at 8:30 in the morning and then told James that we were up at 6am doing all sorts of things while we were sleeping.....
Not necessarily the spot to go if you're going to make any noise in the bedroom.  Otherwise it was great with lots of instruction manuals and info.

I rented the house for 20 days for my parents who were visiting me in Montreal. We liked the location and the view very much. The price wasn't too high. The experience was okay but not the best experience I've had with Airbnb places. Some complications occurred, and the host expected my collaboration in solving the problem. The internet didn't work for the first three days, and it took the host some time to accept that there was a problem and solve it. The host was friendly and apologized when I expressed my dissatisfaction with something but not as respectful as what I expected. For example,  when I went to pick up the keys, he was still busy cleaning the bathroom and doing the laundry, and he jokingly asked me to help him with preparing the house.

name: Fantastic Soho/Tribeca Loft
summary: Great space.  Clean, safe, bright.  5 Skylights. Walk, bike to Chinatown, Little Italy, Wall St., River.  Citibike close, fantastic restaurants, bakery.  Cool bathtub, flat screens, dsl, two desks. Fully furnished.  Bed, couches, aerobeds. Minimum rental one month. Cable, wifi, heat and gas included,  Tenant pays for electricity.
space: This is a very bright, quiet, relaxing space. The loft is very roomy, has five skylights, a fireplace and all modern conveniences.  The building has charm and character.  It is not a cookie cutter high rise, but a small building with personality. It has wifi, cable and is air-conditioned. It has flat screen cvs in the living area and bedroom. Bathroom has a beautiful claw foot bath tub. The kitchen is fantastic and spacious and there is a washer and dryer in the loft.  The bedroom has an antique brass bed and small bed and plenty of closet space. The living room has a huge L shaped sofa that can sleep two and I have a double aero bed. Plenty of linen and towels.

neighborhood_overview: This is the premiere neighborhood in New York. Close to all subways. Cabs right outside. Great restaurants everywhere. Ten minutes to midtown and the Broadway theaters , five minutes to the Village.  Walk to Chinatown and Little Italy.
notes: Wifi and cable included.  Guests pay for electricity.
transit: All subways are a short walk.  A, E, C are right downstairs.  R, N, M, G are two blocks.  1, 2, 3 are one block.  4, 5, 6 is three blocks.  Take the train downstairs one stop and get the F and D.
access: Guests will have use of the entire space.
interaction: I will be available to help guests with whatever they may need and know the city and surrounding areas very well.
house_rules: No smoking, no parties, no strangers.  It is a small very cute building.  Everyone knows everyone.  It is a very charming environment. Tenant pays electricity.  Gas, heat, cable, internet included.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: College professor who teaches theatre arts. I also like to boat. I’m a licensed Captain and have my own boat in Montauk. I am into a healthy lifestyle and eat vegan food!  I’m easygoing and friendly and like meeting new people!

reviews.comments: Everything about Sal's loft is EXCEPTIONAL- location, amenities, host, et al. We had such an incredible stay there and after just the first of our 10 days, truly felt like it was a second home.  The loft is actually FAR more spacious than the pictures indicate...and the high ceilings, wall of windows, and skylights give it even more semblance of grandeur.  2 aero beds fit super comfortably in the living room and with 4 of us there at one point, we never felt too crowded.  Amazing restaurants and shopping nearby, too.  It's perfect, really.  Thank you, Sal, for being so hospitable and making our trip to Manhattan a memorable one!

Sal's place is a total gem in beautiful Tribeca. We stayed for almost three months and loved our time there. What you see in the photos is what you get - this is definitely a no frills spot. But, it's a huge space for New York, and we'll take no frills with ample space any day.
The host canceled this reservation 5 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

We stayed for two months at Sal's. He was friendly, a great communicator and everything was as listed. It's a very generously proportioned apartment for New York, therefore great value for money if you're looking for something a little different from the typical foursquare room with kitchen bar etc. It is a home so it comes with years of love and life, and testament to that is the incredibly well stocked kitchen - everything you could ever need to (Website hidden by Airbnb) end of utensils and so on. A great space to unwind and spread out; two people will not feel cramped. I would be lying if I said it was not unquiet outside the window; the passing traffic is busy during the day and drivers are energetic with their car horns - but this is New York, that's why we visit! If you fancy diving right into New York life and live like a real New Yorker for a few weeks we highly recommend Sal and his apartment to give you that opportunity. The location couldn't be better - the A,C,E train entrance is tripping distance from the front door, blink and you'll slip down into it- Canal Street's other stops are all 2 mins walk away. To the south of Canal Street is Tribeca, and Sal's place is like the gateway to Tribeca. Please tourists, don't bother with Times Square...just avoid it like the plague - hang out and eat down here and get the fast train up to the park. Highly recommend Everyman Espresso round the corner from Sal's; within minutes of downing one of their excellent espressos you are in Soho, or Chinatown or on the waterfront or in the shadow of Wall Street. Yep, it's a great place to wake up in and see what we think is the proper New York. And Sal is very personable and eager to help with any issues that may arise.

name: Fantastic Light Filled Room in Newtown
summary: Large Queen Size bedroom in a 2 bedroom Semi house in Sydney's vibrant Inner West. Newtown celebrates it's array of fantastic food, cafes, boutique bars and great shopping. Great location, conveniently; 15 minutes from airport, 500m from train station, 7 minute train ride to City, 5 min walk to King Street with local shops, restaurants, bars at your door step.  Bonus with Enmore Theatre, home of live music.  Bus direct to Sydney's beautiful Coogee Beach.   Safe and friendly local neighbourhood.
space: Light filled open planned modern space with everything that can help make you relax after a busy day sight seeing.   Ceiling fan in the bedroom and lounge room for added comfort.

neighborhood_overview: Discover colourful and unconventional Newtown, a vibrant inner Sydney neighbourhood with a thriving music, theatre, design and restaurant scene. King Street is a delicious ‘eat street’ and cool shopping strip, with a marvellous range of designer boutiques, vintage stores and specialty shops.
notes: Friendly Moodle puppy called Molly.
transit: 500m from train station, 7 minute train ride to City, 5 min walk to King Street and near bus stop. 15 minutes from Sydney International Airport in Uber or Taxi.
access: Guests share all common areas in the form of kitchen, lounge and dining room.
interaction: I've lived within the area for the last 15 years so happy to help with any recommendations.   I'm a full time professional who's at work Monday to Friday and on the weekends a busy social life, if not walking my dog.
house_rules: Please be mindful of our neighbours.  Remember to lock the font door upon leaving as we have our dog and would hate for her to get out and lost. Having friends over is fine by us but again please be mindful of our neighbours and noise past 11:30pm. Smoking is allowed ONLY on the front porch or backyard. I am a non smokers but understand this is a need. Please make sure doors and windows are closed before you smoke. Please don't feed the dog no matter how cute she looks at you. I know this is not always possible but we try and keep her to a semi regular routine and this will help. She does like walks however, so if you feel inclined just ask me first.

host.host_about: Cool Single Mum, travel with my daughter and also alone. Love meeting new people and seeing the World.

reviews.comments: Alles gut. Sehr zu empfehlen. Super gelegene whg. In der nähe vom hippen Quartier Newtown. Alles gut und tolle tipps.

We stayed at Clare’s place for 4 nights in Sydney. Everything about it was amazing. Great central location, with the public transportation leaving from just a few minutes by walk. Newtown itself is a vibrant neighborhood with lots of nice bars and restaurants, but Clare’s place is secluded and very silent. Clare provided us with some useful local tips, and is really friendly. The room is spacious with a nice bed, and Mollie is the cutest puppy dog you will get to meet!! Will definitely recommend the place, we will come back here once again in Sydney!

Calre is a great, communicative host with positive attitude. She loves her life, she loves Newton and is willing to show the neighbourhood, additionally she helps us to find ourselves in new city. Place was clean, warm and comfortable. What's more there is a cute puppy called Molly, one of the best we met :)

Myself and partner had a great stay at Claire's. Claire's place is clean, modern and very close to the train station, just a few minutes walk. There's also Newtown, just a walk away for cafe's, shops etc. Her dog Molly was also very cute. Thanks for our stay. Would recommend to others.

Enjoyed my time staying in Clare’s house. Her place was modern and clean. The proximity to the train station was perfect. I could go anywhere I want easily. Its in the quiet end of Newtown so you wont get bothered by the youthful crowd. Clare made my stay as comfortable as possible giving me tips and tricks around the area and the city. Wouldn’t mind staying there again in the future.

Loved the place and loved Clare too! Lovely house, Molly the dog is lovely too (hide your socks though she likes to take em haha). The location was great, Clare was great, she let us check in at 8 in the morning as we had an overnight bus from Melbourne! Stay was above and beyond our already high expectations :).
Claire was a phenomenal host. Welcoming, easy going, and full of great tips for exploring the neighbourhood.

We had a great stay at Clare's place while we were in town to see if we would like to move Sydney. Clarw was really flexible and responsive to our very last minute arrangements and even let us leave our bags on the last day, which was really helpful. The room was great and excellent location to see Newtown and the rest of the city via the train! Thanks for a great stay

Clare is so friendly and a great host, Molly her dog is so lovely!!. The room is nice & clean, the bed is really comfortable and the ceiling fan is perfect for summer. Location is really good if you want to try Sydney’s great train system you get to central station in a few minutes.

Super chill vibe, adorable dog and great location. Only a 5 min walk to Train Station which makes getting around super easy. Also a 5 min walk to bus to Coogee, which is an amazing beach. House is neat and has a lovely atmosphere which is nice to come home too. I'd stay here again!
